teams.name: Hemp Out
teams.loan_because: It’s in our nature, and it’s the right thing to do.
teams.description: We’re a kind group of lenders opposed to marijuana prohibition in the United States.  We feel pot should be decriminalized, taxed, and regulated much the same way alcohol is.  It’s our goal to recruit 420 members that aren’t afraid of a little weed in order to form a community of open-minded lenders that would like to “hemp out”.      Please visit www.norml.org to learn more about cannabis legalization. There’s nothing wrong with ganja; legalize bud!

teams.name: Build India
teams.loan_because: We want to make a difference to Power Rural India.
teams.description:
We are committed to bring prosperity to rural India as we believe that insufficient resources to make a decent living in villages is the reason that most of our villagers migrate to cities aggravating the problems of already crowded cities. We aim to develop sustainable infrastructure in villages to improve the quality of life for people in Rural India.

We are currently interested in collaborating with individuals and companies interested in expanding the concept of integrating microfinance with renewable power generation to finance utility scale solar and wind power projects in India in association with KIVA

teams.name: Cheeseheads For Change
teams.loan_because: If you give a man a fish, you feed him for a day.  Now in the modern world, you can give that same man a loan to buy a fishing pole, he catches fish with his new pole to feed his family, his community improves because of his financial success, he pays the loan back, and  you can re-loan that money again to help someone else buy a fishing pole . . . wait, that sounds like a conspiracy by the Rapala Corporation to sell more fishing equipment, what are we supporting here ;-)
teams.description: Our Kiva lending team is a non-political group consisting of Green Bay Packers fans lovingly known as Cheeseheads, and anyone who lives in or has ties to the great state of Wisconsin and is interested in making the world a better place.

teams.name: BRAC Tanzania
teams.loan_because:
We believe that BRAC Tanzania is empowering Tanzanian women to lift themselves and their families out of poverty. 


We want to show our support for an organization that approaches poverty alleviation from a holistic viewpoint, providing a range of programs to enable women to be agents of change.


More than this, we loan because we want to support these Tanzanian women with loans from around the world!
teams.description:
The BRAC Tanzania lending team is for anyone who is interested in Tanzania, BRAC, or BRAC Tanzania!


If you've heard of BRAC, you know that they are enabling positive change in many countries across Asia, the Middle East, and Africa. If you haven't heard of BRAC, check it out here:


http://www.brac.net/
and here:
http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=102


This team is specifically designed for BRAC Tanzania, which supports Tanzanian women through microfinance and other programs. 


Join us!!

teams.description: We are New Englanders, located in the northeast corner of the United States. We hail from towns dotted along the Green Mountains of Vermont and the sandy coastlines of the Bay and Ocean States. The White Mountains and wilderness of (the free state) New Hampshire and the Gold Coast of Connecticut we call our home. The dense forests of Maine lend us the Pine Tree emblem affixed upon our flag proudly uniting the region for hundreds of years and today our cause for empowering people around the world. We welcome anyone who wishes to join us!

teams.name: Friends of Bob Harris
teams.loan_because:
After stumbling into a job as a luxury travel writer, I saw so much poverty that I decided to turn those paychecks into Kiva loans. Then I visited a bunch of clients, who were amazing, and I've written a book about it called "The International Bank of Bob" (Walker/Bloomsbury, March 5, 2013).

I hope the book will get more people to feel a greater understanding of Kiva, a better appreciation of the role of microfinance, and most of all, more connected to the rest of the world.
teams.description: People who realize that if we switched places with the recipients, they'd loan to us just as happily.  So, fair's fair.

teams.loan_because:
The RamblingRat Overland Project - started by Tim Dennis of United Kingdom Scotland.
After selling his house, Tim created a partnership with StreetKids International (www.streetkids.org).  Circumnavigating the world in his Toyota Landcruiser, he is able to use his interactive mobile camping expedition vehicle to communicate the importance of the basic needs of water, food and shelter to the children and adults within the communities he visits.... basic needs that are not guaranteed to all children in our small world.
We loan because we want to encourage young people to help other young people better their lives by equipping them with the tools they need to become independent and self sufficient.
teams.description: People from the four corners of the world who want to work together to support projects that help young people.  Our small lenders can team up together to make a bigger impact in our world.  Join the RamblingRat Overland Project team to make a difference in a life, a family, or a community.

teams.name: Happy Kiva Lenders
teams.description:
We Happy Kiva Lenders think Kiva is great and are happy to see Kiva lending to everyone including US citizens.  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 
People in need are people in need regardless of where they live.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 


Our Goal is to show our support for Kiva's decision to fight poverty everywhere!
Please join us Happy Kiva Lenders and showing your support for Kiva by lending to whomever you want! 

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

 You can help in 3 ways - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -   
1) Join this team! - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2) Make a loan!  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 
3) Share this page with your friends! - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  - - - - - -  

 - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 


Through our numbers and our loans we'll let Kiva know that they have our support in fighting poverty everywhere!

We fully fund all loans. Join our Team & show your support for parents. FREE!

teams.name: USA 4 Equality
teams.loan_because: Everyone needs a helping hand now and then.
teams.description:
Formerly  "USA Against Kiva Bigots", This group was created in direct opposition to "Unhappy Kiva Lenders" Group.  Our name changed upon termination of the aforementioned group.

A person should not be judged based on their race, religion, sex, age, or place of residence.

We all need everyones help.  The world would be a much better place if people treated others the way they expected to be treated in return.

People in the USA should not be denied loans due to the misconception we are all rich.
The U.S. citizen you deny today could have been your neighbor last year.

teams.name: Kiva Team Captains
teams.loan_because: We want to bring people together to raise awareness about Kiva in our communities.
teams.description: This group is about empowering Team Captains to become Community Marketers.  It is our goal to provide Kiva's biggest advocates with more tools to spread the word about Kiva.

teams.name: KivaFriends - Single Parent Loans

teams.description: We are a group of lenders throughout the world that want to help men and women be successful in raising their own families.

for we are young and free,    -

teams.name: hi5 Community on Kiva!
teams.loan_because: “Kiva’s principles of entrepreneurship, serving a global community, and leveraging the power of crowds are very complementary to hi5’s mission, so it seems only natural that we join them in the fight to help eradicate poverty in many parts of the developing world,” said Ramu Yalamanchi, CEO of hi5. “By linking our user base with the profiles of Kiva entrepreneurs, we are connecting a diverse group of people who want to change our world for the better and ensure the right resources exist to do it.”
teams.description: Headquartered in San Francisco, hi5 is one of the world’s largest and fastest growing social networks and mobile web networks. Our focus is to empower our users to build and maintain connections between friends and family online. With over 56 million unique visitors every month, hi5 is a top 20 website globally and the number one social network in 31 countries across Latin America, Europe, Asia and Africa. The service is available in 37 languages, delivering localized content and applications to users worldwide.

**The inherent worth and dignity of every person
**Justice, equity and compassion in human relations
**Acceptance of one another and encouragement to spiritual growth in our congregations
**A free and responsible search for truth and meaning
**The right of conscience and the use of the democratic process within our congregations and in society at large

teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!
teams.description:
One of P2P's major poverty-escaping projects is to participate in making microloans through the Kiva platform. See the web site for details on all of our projects. Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.

teams.description: "We all teach citizenship and caring with everything we do. This group is going to allow us to show it in force. No Child Left Behind taken to the higher level, out of politics and into concern for all the families of our global neighborhood."  -A Team member

teams.description:
We are property investors (landlords), mainly from Australia, and we meet via an online forum where we share knowledge and ideas. Most of us have never met in real life, but we nonetheless share great friendship and mutual support.

* This group is an initiative of some forum contributors, but is not endorsed by the Somersoft company who sponsor the forum. *

teams.name: GLBT (Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual, Transgender) Kivans & Friends
teams.loan_because: We are out and proud and know what it is like to face barriers. We are privileged to help our entrepreneurs achieve their own equality. We thank our friends who join us in our loans & in supporting GLBT rights.
teams.description: We are gay, lesbian, bisexual, transgender, homosexual, and heterosexual people from all over the world.

teams.name: Kiva Team Italia - Italy
teams.loan_because:
"Migliorare la vita degli altri migliora anche la tua" ....   .....  ...........
Improving lives of others also improves yours
teams.description:
Una bella fotografia della nostra splendida realtà… Bellissima, variegata, colorata, vivace… unica…. Italiana!!!!

--------------------------------

A beautiful picture of our wonderful reality… Beautiful, varied, colorful, lively.... unique……. Italian!

teams.name: IP Lab Catania
teams.loan_because: Giving is the best picture we can ever ever take!
teams.description: Academic research team oriented to graphics,vision and multimedia

We believe that providing microloans to entrepreneurs in developing countries is the socially responsive way of helping people break the circle of poverty. 

We promote Kiva.org as a sustainable and transparent way of connecting lenders and borrowers from across the globe.

teams.name: Vegetarians and Vegans on Kiva
teams.loan_because: We have a vision of a healthier, more compassionate and sustainable world. Hard work is often not enough to escape poverty and we gladly welcome the opportunity to give people and their businesses a fighting chance. Our team focus is on making loans to borrowers who don't use animals in their businesses.
teams.description: We're vegetarians and vegans, and those thinking about making the change.  We welcome everyone regardless of their motivation for going veggie.

teams.name: Vegans for Peace and Harmony
teams.loan_because: we want to support non-animal businesses in under-served areas around the world. By doing this, we can show that you don't have to destroy the environment or murder sentient beings in order to make a living.
teams.description: Out to prove by example that you can end world hunger, save the environment, stop cruelty, end the energy crisis, prevent oil spills, end the health care crisis, end the dominance of big pharma, and be healthy just by being VEGAN...

teams.name: hi5 Community on Kiva!
teams.loan_because: “Kiva’s principles of entrepreneurship, serving a global community, and leveraging the power of crowds are very complementary to hi5’s mission, so it seems only natural that we join them in the fight to help eradicate poverty in many parts of the developing world,” said Ramu Yalamanchi, CEO of hi5. “By linking our user base with the profiles of Kiva entrepreneurs, we are connecting a diverse group of people who want to change our world for the better and ensure the right resources exist to do it.”
teams.description: Headquartered in San Francisco, hi5 is one of the world’s largest and fastest growing social networks and mobile web networks. Our focus is to empower our users to build and maintain connections between friends and family online. With over 56 million unique visitors every month, hi5 is a top 20 website globally and the number one social network in 31 countries across Latin America, Europe, Asia and Africa. The service is available in 37 languages, delivering localized content and applications to users worldwide.

teams.name: WORLD PEACE
teams.loan_because: We want to promote a harmonious, eco-sustainable, and prosperous human civilization on planet Earth.
teams.description: We envision and to promote a world of enduring peace, universal sustainable development, and advancement of human civilization.

teams.name: Kiva Team Germany
teams.loan_because: Showing interest in the life of others and giving a helping hand if needed is important.

We've heard the call of nations wide,

As one we all shall be      -

teams.name: Paying It Forward
teams.loan_because: We feel our lives have benefitted from the generosity of others and want to "Pay It Forward' by helping others through Kiva loans.  Join us if you want to return some favours to the world.
teams.description: The cost of one 'dinner out for two' is enough for people working their way out of poverty to have the chance to improve their lives. Repaid loans can continue to be relent over and over into the future, helping many hundreds in our lifetimes.

teams.name: Wind Power Now
teams.loan_because: We want to make the world a better place.
teams.description: Wind power today for a better tomorrow.  Wind power emits no greenhouse gases, no air pollution and no water pollution and it uses no water.  It requires no mining or drilling for fuel, and it produces no hazardous waste. It is a tremendous rural development tool.  For more info, see http://www.yes2wind.com , a Web site on wind created by Friends of the Earth, Greenpeace and the World Wildlife Fund.

teams.name: Church of the Flying Spaghetti Monster
teams.loan_because:
"Thou shalt share, that none may seek without funding."   A nod to VII.  of “RANDOM NUMBER OF NOT COMMANDMENTS, SUGGESTIONS"  in the LOOSE CANON:
http://www.loose-canon.info/page17.htm
teams.description:
Members of the Church of the Flying Spaghetti Monster  

Secular vs religious Field Partners, see links at http://atheist-monkey.blogspot.de/2009/08/kiva-mfi-checker.html

teams.name: Kiva Team Captains
teams.loan_because: We want to bring people together to raise awareness about Kiva in our communities.
teams.description: This group is about empowering Team Captains to become Community Marketers.  It is our goal to provide Kiva's biggest advocates with more tools to spread the word about Kiva.

teams.name: Women In Hats!
teams.loan_because: Hats need company.
teams.description: We like women in hats, caps, scarves, veils, crowns, beanies – you name it!  (We like men wearing that stuff too! :-)

teams.name: Oxfam
teams.loan_because: We aim to increase the number of people who have a sustainable livelihood, access to social services, an effective voice in decisions, safety from conflict and disaster, and equal rights and status.
teams.description: A global movement of dedicated people working hard to fight poverty and injustice. We believe that respect for human rights will help lift people out of poverty.

teams.name: Women Who Lend To Shirtless Men
teams.loan_because: We can't resist :D

teams.name: Babies!
teams.loan_because: Just look at those babies!!!
teams.description: In love with babies.  :-)

teams.name: Music Educators
teams.loan_because: We hope to see an increase in the number of children attending school and this has more chance of happening when families are not living in poverty.
teams.description: A group of educators specifically interested and involved in music education.

teams.name: Humanist
teams.loan_because: It takes people to help people.  We believe in good.
teams.description:
Humanists strive to live good and ethical lives, with no belief in the supernatural.  We give meaning and purpose to our lives through reason, compassion and action.

Most Atheists and non-religious people ARE Humanists, but don't realize it!

Our team helps the poor, builds the Humanist community and shows that non-religious people give, care and share.

We are endorsed by the American Humanist Association, British Humanist Association and International Humanist and Ethical Union.

teams.name: Friends of Bob Harris
teams.loan_because:
After stumbling into a job as a luxury travel writer, I saw so much poverty that I decided to turn those paychecks into Kiva loans. Then I visited a bunch of clients, who were amazing, and I've written a book about it called "The International Bank of Bob" (Walker/Bloomsbury, March 5, 2013).

I hope the book will get more people to feel a greater understanding of Kiva, a better appreciation of the role of microfinance, and most of all, more connected to the rest of the world.
teams.description: People who realize that if we switched places with the recipients, they'd loan to us just as happily.  So, fair's fair.

teams.name: Lone Lenders
teams.loan_because:
This is a team dedicated to those times when you are the only lender to fund a loan all by yourself. Yes, it's a bit ironic to have a team for this purpose, but that's part of the charm!

The ultimate in person-to-person microcredit!

teams.name: Older Borrowers
teams.loan_because: we want to support the bravery and exuberance of Kiva's older entrepreneurs!
teams.description:
We want to celebrate and support those of mature years who, whether through choice or necessity, keep working and struggling to improve their own lives and the lives of others. 

We generally define older as 50+, given that in many Kiva countries average life expectancy is between 50 & 70 years.

teams.name: Team Turquoise
teams.loan_because: We love the turquoise color in pictures.

teams.name: Fabulous Fabrics Fans
teams.loan_because: We love the fabrics created, sold, or worn by Kiva borrowers all over the world.
teams.description: Lenders who value and enjoy the photos on Kiva that include fabulous fabrics.  We appreciate the glimpses those photos provide to us, of the borrowers' lovely cultures.

teams.name: Canberra ACT Australia
teams.loan_because: "Necessitous people are not free people" FDR. We believe in empowering people by providing the means to make a living.  Help us make a difference.
teams.description: We are Australians who care.

teams.name: Green Oranges Book Club
teams.loan_because: it's what we do!
teams.description:
This team grew out of the Supporting Younger Borrowers team and is a place for us to meet to talk about books, particularly books that help us better to understand the borrowers and countries to whom we lend.

UP NEXT: The House of Spirits by Isabel Allende

The following are the books that have already been read by the group – due to the free-spirited natures of the members of this group combined with their unending ability to be sidetracked by other books and side discussions along the way, there has not been set times for reading/discussing books. 

(9) Small Island, by Andrea Levy (Jamaica)
(8) The International Bank of Bob by Bob Harris (worldwide)
(7) The House of the Mosque by Kader Abdolah (Iran)
(6) The No. 1 Ladies' Detective Agency by Alexander McCall Smith (Botswana)
(5) Half the Sky by Nicholas Kristoff & Sheryl WuDunn (worldwide)
(4) King Peggy by Peggielene Bartels & Eleanor Herman (Ghana)
(3) The Beauty of Humanity Movement by Camilla Gibb (Vietnam)
(2) Banker to the Poor by Muhammad Yunus (Bangladesh)
(1) Green Oranges on Lion Mountain by Emily Joy (Sierra Leone)

Suggested Books:

I Shall Not Hate: A Gaza Doctor's Journey by Izzeldin Abuelaish (Palestinian territories)
Cutting for Stone by Abraham Verghese (India)
The Hospital by the River  by Dr. Catherine Hamlin (Ethiopia)
Frontier Justice- The Global Refugee Crisis by Andy Lamey (worldwide) 
The Blue Sweater by Jacqueline Novogratz (Rwanda)
Revolution Baby by Saffia Farr (Kyrgyzstan)
Closing the Food Gap by Mark Winne (United States)
Desert Flower by Waris Dirie (Somalia)
Half of a Yellow Sun by Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie (Nigeria)
Things Fall Apart by Chinua Achebe (Nigeria)
The Thing Around Your Neck by Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie (Nigeria)
Sweetness in the Belly by Camilla Gibb (Ethiopia)
Replenishing the Earth by Wangari Matthai (Kenya)
Little Princes  by Conor Grennan (Nepal)
Three Cups of Tea by Greg Mortensen and David Renin (Pakistan)
Three Cups of Deceit by Jon Krakauer (Pakistan)
Damned Nations by Dr. Samantha Nutt (worldwide)
Mighty Be Our Powers by Leymah Gbowee (Liberia)
What Is the What: The Autobiography of Valentino Achak Deng  by Dave Eggars (Sudan)
The Road of Lost Innocence by Somaly Mam (Cambodia)
The Bite of the Mango by Mariatu Kamara (Sierra Leone)
The Rugmaker of Maza-e-Sharif by Najaf Mazari (Afghanistan)
The Lady Cyclist's Guide to Kashgar by Suzanne Joinson (China)
The Hundred Year Old Man who Climbed Out of the Window and Disappeared by Jonas Jonasson (worldwide)
And the Mountains Echoed by Khaled Hosseini (Afghanistan)
The Book Thief by Markus Zusak (Germany)
The End of Poverty by Jeffrey Sachs (worldwide)
The Life You Can Save by Peter Singer (worldwide)
The God of Small Things by Arundhati Roy (India)
A Thousand Splendid Suns by Khaled Hosseini (Afghanistan)
The Kite Runner by Khaled Hosseini (Afghanistan)
A Fine Balance by Rohinton Mistry (India)
The Last Hunger Season by Roger Thurow (Kenya)

teams.name: Small Whispers
teams.loan_because: Small things can make a huge difference to a persons life.
teams.description: Kivaholic aunt with her only nephew, his toy dog Reeves and a Kiva friend too. We want to see how many people we can help.

teams.name: Team USA
teams.loan_because: We believe in the generosity of the human spirit that is still alive within Americans of all backgrounds.

teams.name: Sweden
teams.description: Sometimes it's easier to see that what a difference we each make by looking at what we do together -- And having more people together might even convince others to join and lend as well. Feel free to join up if you're a Kiva member in Sweden!

teams.name: Kiva Buddhists
teams.loan_because: We water seeds of awakening.
teams.description: We are Buddhists of all variety, but focus here is on the way of the Boddhisatva.

teams.name: Mensa
teams.loan_because: Goals of the association involve "identify and foster human intelligence for the benefit of humanity" and "to encourage research into the nature, characteristics, and uses of intelligence".
teams.description:
We are members of Mensa from all around the world. 
Mensa is an international association of people with high IQ, who usually share some interests and hobbies.
One of the purposes of the association is to provide a stimulating intellectual and social environment for high IQ people.
Mensa is strictly neutral in politics and religious issues.

teams.name: Team Europe
teams.loan_because: We think Kiva is a unique opportunity for people all over the world to assist entrepreneurs in improving their businesses and communities.
teams.description: We are European lenders (EU, EFTA, and all those who feel they belong) who share the belief in Kiva's vision.

teams.name: United Kingdom
teams.loan_because: We realise how lucky we are to have been born into one of the world's richest countries. We want to help hard-working people who have been less fortunate.
teams.description: Rain-accepting, overtaxed, sleep-deprived tea-drinkers.

teams.name: Team England
teams.description: Let's see what we can do together and spread the word round England of this amazing venture called Kiva.

teams.name: Amistad Salone
teams.loan_because:
Schooner Amistad - a recreation of a historical vessel retraced in 2007/2008 the infamous triangle of slave trade representing not only Connecticut and the United States but all who believe that collective intelligence and goodness of humanity can rise above ignorance and evil. 
Amistad  sailed into Freetown, Sierra Leone in December 2007 and stayed there for two months. She is for Sierra Leoneans  a symbol of freedom and hope; they call it Sengbe’s boat [after Sengbe Pieh, the leader of the Africans in a historic revolt in 1839]. For us to sail it in, was an honor  and a privilege.

 We have witnessed personally in Sierra Leone how little is needed to make a real change in life of the people. Sierra Leone is still the last country on the UN Human Development Index.
teams.description: Everybody who believes in the Amistad's mission is welcome to join.

teams.name: Kiva Team Germany

teams.description: We are some fellows from Germany who believe in the concept of Kiva.

teams.description: We are a group of people who enjoy attending a music festival in New York State each year.  The festival presents all sorts of music from around the globe, and we share the love of that music.

teams.name: Maria Shriver + A Woman's Nation
teams.loan_because: For as little as $25, we can help women entrepreneurs right in our own backyard.
teams.description:
Continuing what she began as First Lady of California, Maria Shriver and A Woman’s Nation are partnering with Kiva, the world's first person-to-person microlending website, to empower thousands of women across America to become more financially independent. Our partnership shows that every loan you make to a woman entrepreneur – even $25 – will make a real difference. 

As "The Shriver Report: A Woman’s Nation Pushes Back from the Brink"* states, 1 in 3 American women lives on or near the brink of poverty. By starting or expanding her own business, a woman can lift herself and her family off the brink. JOIN US in moving women and families forward!

A Woman’s Nation™ is a nonprofit organization founded by Maria Shriver that imagines a new way forward for women and men, girls and boys. Through its multimedia initiatives and innovative partnerships, A Woman's Nation informs, inspires, and implements bold ideas into action with the goal of creating a culture where all lives and all work are respected, recognized, and valued. To learn more please visit AWomansNation.org.
 
* A project of A Woman's Nation, produced in partnership with Center for American Progress.

teams.name: Build India
teams.loan_because: We want to make a difference to Power Rural India.
teams.description:
We are committed to bring prosperity to rural India as we believe that insufficient resources to make a decent living in villages is the reason that most of our villagers migrate to cities aggravating the problems of already crowded cities. We aim to develop sustainable infrastructure in villages to improve the quality of life for people in Rural India.

We are currently interested in collaborating with individuals and companies interested in expanding the concept of integrating microfinance with renewable power generation to finance utility scale solar and wind power projects in India in association with KIVA

teams.name: Give Green - Environmental Loans
teams.loan_because: We want the world to be a better place.
teams.description:
Made of individual kiva lenders who are concerned about the environmental impacts of their loans. This is a forum to notify each other of environmentally sustainable loans that are needing funding. Sustainable development projects include recycling, solar, re-use, organic agriculture, health, etc. 

We support enterprises that care about the earth and all of its inhabitants. We have no religious, racial or political affiliations of any kind. We want to encourage sustainable enterprises that recycle, reuse, repurpose and use environmentally sound agricultural and manufacturing practices. 
Many of us would like Kiva to develop environmental standards or criteria for their lending practices to prevent environmental impacts that would increase poverty for future generations.
Many people want to have a green portfolio, or at least a green component. 
Won't you join us in creating true sustainability that includes a healthy environment?
